column4: after doing a memory test for an hour, and checking for overheat (wich is not a prob.) the gutsy OS now restarts every time i log in, right after typing the passwd, wich means i cant do anything.. should i reinstall ubuntu or is there an other way to solve this problem???
I had X restarting all the time because of bad videocard/screen configuration
what do you mean by X? ..i'm a noob :/
the system is one thing, and the windowing system is another thing
X is the windowing system
I think only your X is rebooting
look down and left, options or something, and try the gnome failsafe session
will try
can you see it?
wait, need to start ubuntu again
remote login via XDMCP, is that it?
no
it is gnome failsafe
should say that
oh
all it says is "select language", "select session","remote login via XDMCP","restart","shut down" and "suspend"
select session
there you will find the failsafe gnome session
ah, select session->failsafe gnome.. found it :)
still restarts :(
sorry, cant help
